fields.description:
Hello Folks!

Trying to set up a custom JIRA Issue Collector at present. Having difficulty with the form loading - the dialog comes up, the trigger works, but there is no content in the dialog.

Funny thing is, if I use the Raise a Bug or Feedback defaults it works. The only things I have changes on the custom one is the title. 

This is in OnDemand, so 6.x-something?

Thanks,
Muldoon
fields.summary: Custom JIRA Issue Collector does not load from JIRA OnDemand

fields.description:
Environment -
Browser: Firefox 20.0
Operating system: Mac OS
URL: https://open.jira.com/secure/VersionBoard.jspa

Steps to reproduce -
1. Opened https://open.jira.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa URL
2. Click on 'projects' and then click on 'Pebble' project
3. Click on Agile -> Classic
4. From the list of the tickets, click on '1 subs' link on any particular ticket, for example - PEBBLE-18
5. When 'sub tasks' pop up opens, look for a close button or a way to close it

Actual Result:
There is no close link or close button to close the pop up, there is no workaround to it, so user has to go to the dashboard by changing the url

Expected Result:
There should be a close button on top right corner of the pop up
fields.summary: popup of sub-tasks on classic taskboard (in not logged in state) do not have any option to close

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32575].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to reproduce

# Edit a project description
# Enter "atlassian.com" in the URL field
# Write down some non-default description
# Submit the form

h4. Outcome

* The URL field validation warns about "The URL specified is not valid - it must start with http://"
* The description field is reset to default

When you try to send a notification to a user that does not have permission to actually see the issue, JIRA sends the mail to the mail queue but does not actually send the email (as expected).

The problem is that there's no indication why the email is not sent to the user.

There's absolutely nothing logged in the JIRA logs and the notification helper doesn't verify that ([JRA-30447|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-30447]).

It would be great if the mail did not get sent to the mail queue in the first place, since it won't be actually sent.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32548].
  {panel}

Lets say you have some *required* custom fields with *context* configured specifically for Project A, and you want to move an issue from Project B to Project A. When you move the issue, JIRA will prompt you to update those required fields through the UI. (This is step 3 of 4)

The order in which the custom fields appear does not match the order of the custom fields that you set up in the Issue Edit Screen. 

Example:
1. When I Edit an issue, I am presented with the Edit Issue screen like so: [^EditIssue.jpg]
2. When I attempt to move an issue into this project, of this issue type, the *step 3 of 4* of the Move process will prompt me to key in values for those required fields. The order of the custom fields differs: [^MoveIssue.jpg]

This can cause confusion for some customers who require those fields to be ordered exactly as they were in the Edit Issue screen.
fields.summary: Order fields on bulk move screen according to the order designated on the edit issue screen.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32537].
  {panel}

Given the following situation :

# A filter is created that has results spanning more than 1 page
# The user navigated through that filter to find a certain issue (that is not at the first page)
# The issue is accessed, and edited
# The user goes back to the filter via the 'Issues' dropdown menu.

Currently, after the fourth step, when the user goes back to the filter, they will be returned to the first page of the filter results. This can be problematic and somewhat frustrating when the user has a high amount of results in the filter (for example, a few hundred issues).

It would be more efficient if the user can be returned to the results page where they accessed the issue earlier. For example, if the issue that the user accessed is in page 3 of the Issue Navigator results, then when the user accesses the same filter, he/she will straightaway go to page 3 of the Issue Navigator.
fields.summary: Return to the selected issue in Issue Navigator after an operation

    In order for Single Sign On to work, jTDS must be able to load the native

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32531].
  {panel}

Copied from https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/JIM-918

As stated in the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Importing+Data+from+CSV#ImportingDatafromCSV-TipsforimportingCSVdataintoJIRAfields]:
{quote}If not specified in your CSV file, imported issues will be given the default (i.e. first) Priority as specified in your JIRA system  Defining 'Priority' Field Values. You can also create new JIRA values on-the-fly during the import process.{quote}

Therefore, if the priority of the issue is not specified in the CSV file, it should be updated if the default priority has been speicified in JIRA. The behaviour should be the same with Issue Key, where if the issue key is not specified in the CSV file, it will get updated to the default.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Specify the default priority in JIRA
# Create an issue with the priority different from the default
# Create a CSV file with issuekey,summary
# Import the CSV file
# Only Issuetype gets updated but not priority field
fields.summary: The priority does not get updated when editing issue via CSV import

fields.description:
If running an Early Access Program (EAP) release or using an evaluation license in JIRA, the 'Feedback' module is enabled. This results in traffic to [jira.atlassian.com|https://jira.atlassian.com] and [id.atlassian.com|https://id.atlassian.com] in the user's browser. This may take quite a long time to respond and the browsers report as waiting for it, sometimes up to 10-15 seconds.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Install JIRA using an evaluation license;
# Create the DEMO project;
# Try to access an issue and see the traffic through the browser's console.

*Expected Behavior:*
JIRA would only load the content needed, without having to send/receive anything from external websites.

*Actual Behavior:*
There is traffic between JIRA and id.atlassian.com and JAC.

*Workaroud:* Disable the 'Feedback Module' in JIRA - see [How to disable or enable the GOT FEEDBACK button|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/How+to+disable+or+enable+the+GOT+FEEDBACK+button].
fields.summary: Feedbacks in JIRA may cause pages to load slower

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32520].
  {panel}

Not sure "caching" is the best term.  But here's the behavior we had, lost, and would like back again.
This was all working rather nicely before 6.0 but I guess it was undocumented behavior.

When I pull up a filter and select the first item it bring up that Issue with a block on the right corner which has up/down arrows for navigating through that list of issues and a counter indicating where I am "x of Y issues".
If I update an issue, which would cause it to fall outside of the original filter set (eg: assignee=currentUser() and I reassign issue) this navigation block is removed.

What I would like to have is for the Filter set to remain as an navigable list of issues so that I can effectively navigate the entire list without having to requery my filter all the time.

For example: I would like to retrieve a list of all the issues that are assigned to me (eg: "to do") and work through them throughout the day off this list.  In the event that I update/modify/move the issue which would cause it to fall outside of this filter result set, I would like to keep it on this list of "to do" items so that I can continue working through the list.  If I need to regenerate/update the filter results, I can alway use the "return to results" link that used to be there and requery the filter.

Without this functionality there is no efficient or practical way to work through a "to do" list of issues to act upon.
This makes the process of updating multiple tickets in succession very difficult.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32512].
  {panel}

I asked this question in Altassian Answers, but it seems like there is no possible way to do this now, the question is in (https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/154529/is-there-a-way-to-set-field-value-from-parent-but-not-replacing-the-existing-value)

Is there a way to Set Field Value from Parent but not replacing the existing value?

Basically, I am looking for a way to set a value from parent's issue only if the person who file the subtask didn't put a value for a specific field.

Currently, the Set Field Value from Parent is limited to replace existing values which is limited for us.

The example I used is component.

For example, I have a workflow to set component from a parent task. However, we would like the ability for users to put in the necessary component even if it's a different component from the parent's task.

Parent Task has component "A"

I created a subtask under that Parent Task, but fills in component "B"

Ends result right now is that my Subtask has component "A" and component "B" was removed.

Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Workflow Post Function: Set Field Value from Parent additional options

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32510].
  {panel}

It takes about 10 minutes to open report configuration page of JIRA Timesheet Plugin because of 10K groups in Atlassian Crowd directory connected to JIRA.

It may be a regression, as it's working fine on JIRA 5.0.5 and 5.1.8.

Note, problem is even worse for some customers:
* 20 minutes to open report configuration page here https://bitbucket.org/azhdanov/jiratimesheet/issue/346/jira-timesheet-reports-is-working-realy
* OOM here https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/153863/time-sheet-reports-don-t-open-in-jira-5-2-7) 

Steps to reproduce:

Prerequisites:
1) JIRA 5.2.10 (latest)
2) Install Atlassian Crowd (evaluation license is enough) and integrate it with JIRA as described here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Integrating+Crowd+with+Atlassian+JIRA
3) Generate 10K groups (e.g. using ruby script: https://bitbucket.org/azhdanov/jiratimesheet/src/default/src/test/ruby/generate-crowd-groups.rb)
4) JIRA Timesheet Plugin installed (latest version): https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/jira-timesheet-plugin

Scenario:
1) Go to Projects -> e.g. Demo project -> Reports -> Time Sheet Report
2) Expected page loaded in 3s or less, but it hangs for 10 minutes or more , with no any response from server, or even OutOfMemory happens.

Note, problem is caused by Group selector, however backing GroupValuesGenerator is out of concerns, because it's used in Timesheet Gadget also, and there is no any problem with response time.
fields.summary: Very slow response on report configuration page with 10K crowd groups

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32508].
  {panel}

Steps to replicate:

- Create a test issue on a given project using JIRA Default Workflow
- Go to the Issue Navigator and perform a search on this project
- The issue will be retrieved
- Create a new event associated to the Issue Created template
- Make a copy of JIRA Default Workflow and on the "create Issue" transition, change the event from Issue Created to the Custom Event created on the previous step
- Create a new issue
- Go to the issue navigator and perform a search on this project
- The issue created right after the change of events will not be displayed
- Run a background reindex on the instance
- Perform a search on the project again
- The issue still won't be displayed
- Run a full reindex
- Perform a search on the issue navigator for this project. This time the issue *will* be displayed.

I believe the event only sets the notification scheme, and it is not associated with indexing at all, but in this case, it seems to be related to it.

*As a workaround solution:* Please add the "Re-Index Issue" in the post function of the workflow transition if you wish to use the custom event. 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/New+created+issue+is+not+showing+on+the+issue+navigator
fields.summary: Custom event on "create issue" transition and Indexing problems

we using JIRA 5.07 in our company and use the webservice method getIssuesFromJqlSearch( ).
If there is an illegal character in some of the description fields we receive the following response:

AXIS error
Sorry, something seems to have gone wrong... here are the details:
Fault - ; nested exception is: 
        java.io.IOException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: The char '0xb' after 'Enable the maintenance side of the business
Install and geo-tag equipment, including meters
View asset schematics, history, dependencies
Execute to guided workflows
Generate notifications and work orders' is not a valid XML character.
AxisFault
faultCode: {http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/}Server.userException

Install and geo-tag equipment, including meters

Execute to guided workflows
Generate notifications and work orders' is not a valid XML character.
faultActor: 
faultNode:

At the current moment, there is no method for administrator to know if there any attempt made by anyone to login into JIRA that has failed. 

For example: 
* currently the Maximum Authentication Attempts Allowed is set to 3
* when there are more than 3 failed attempt made, the CAPTCHA is shown
* however, administrator are not aware that there are failed attempt unless manually checking in the Users list

It's important for administrator to know especially if the username involved is used by REST client. This is because, the REST client will not be completed as it can't pass the value of the CAPTCHA.

Suggestion: send notification to administrator of username that has exceed the fail attempt so that administrator can clear the login attempt.

fields.description:
When using the "Create Issue" button on JIRA, if it loads with a project that has no Security Level types ("None" is selected) and then I switch to a project that has a single (default) type, it stays at "None". This can cause some problems when expecting the issues to be created with the default type.

Additionally, if the issue creator appears with the protectable project selected, the Security Level properly has the default selected. Switching to a project without any Issue Security and then back to the original also leaves it set to "None"

Ideally the "Security Level" field would reset to the default upon changing projects.

*Workaround*
As a workaround to users that can't upgrade JIRA to 6.0.6, you can disable the Create Issue pop up screen, which will force JIRA to create issues on a whole new screen that will be completely reloaded when project is changed, correctly loading the default security level field.
* [How to disable Create Issue popup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+disable+Create+Issue+popup]
fields.summary: Default Issue Security not chosen when switching projects in issue creator

  {panel}

*Expected behavior:*  Having navigated to a page > 1 in Issue Navigator search results, clicking Tools > Bulk Change: current page, the bulk editor returns the issues on that page.

*Actual behavior:* Clicking Tools > Bulk Change: current page, the bulk editor returns the issues listed on Page 1 of the Issue Navigator results.

*Steps to reproduce:*
In the Issue Navigator
# Search for issues in JIRA, make sure the # of results returned is > 100. Make a note of the issues that appear in page 1 of the results.
# Click the right arrow or page number to navigate to a page other than Page 1.  Make note of the issues  on this page.
# Click *Tools* then select *Bulk Change: current page*
# Note the issue IDs listed are the same as on Page 1 of Issue Navigator results rather than the expected results from a subsequent page. 

*Workaround*
# Follow the above steps. 
#  At the end of the process, click the *Back* button on your browser to return to the Issue Navigator Results.
# Select Tools > Bulk Change: current page again.
# The proper results will appear in the bulk editor.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Typically the LDAP password is not stored for DELEGATING or CONNECTOR user directories, only INTERNAL. However, if you use the migrate users functionality from INTERNAL to DELEGATING it will store the password in the {{cwd_user}} table.

h3. Environment

* PostgreSQL 9.1.
* Mac OS X 10.7.5

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add a delegating user directory.
# Create an internal user.
# Copy the user from internal into it.
# Check the database:
{code:SQL}
select u.id, d.id, u.lower_user_name, u.credential from cwd_user u join cwd_directory d on u.directory_id = d.id and d.directory_type = 'DELEGATING' and credential is not null;
{code}

h3. Expected Results

There is no password there.

h3. Actual Results

The password is stored there, as in the below example:

{noformat}
10012;10000;"dcurrie";"{SHA}BJd5LEruNe6XS6b4S8aKXZvGzlg="
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
As the password has no effect on the username from LDAP on the JIRA database, the password can be deleted from the database
{code}
update cwd_user
set credential = ' '
where user_name='USERNAME';  
{code}

h3. Notes

Additionally, how does it convert that password into the different hashes when it's converting between internal and delegating? It seems internal uses pkcs552 and delegating uses sha.
fields.summary: Copying across a user from JIRA Internal to JIRA Delegated will store the LDAP password in the database
